meanings.definition: A person who relies on practical experience rather than theoretical knowledge.
meanings.sent1: As an empiric, she learned through hands-on practice.
meanings.sent2: The old empiric shared his wisdom gained from years of experience.
meanings.sent3: The young empiric's reliance on real-world trials often led to unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of cooking, the empiric was a master of flavors and techniques.
meanings.sent5: The empiric's approach to problem-solving was always grounded in real-life situations.

meanings.definition: Based on observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
meanings.sent1: Her empiric approach to gardening yielded the most beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The empiric evidence supported the scientist's hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The cat's empiric decision to chase the laser pointer amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His empiric view of the world painted a vivid picture of reality.
meanings.sent5: The empiric method of trial and error proved to be the most effective in this case.
